subject: p11569042
History: -year-old man with dilated esophagus and possible aspiration. Rule out visible aspiration.
Findings: Enlarged opacity abutting the right mediastinum is the patients known dilated esophagus. Opacities at the left lung base are either atelectasis, likely due to low lung volumes versus aspiration in the right clinical context. There are no pleural effusions or pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette is normal in size.
Impression: Findings compatible with known achalasia and atelectasis versus aspiration in the left lower lobe.
